topics.name: Pavel Polityuk
topics.description: Ukraine-based correspondent with almost 30 yearsâ€™ experience and a graduate of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv.

articles.title: Russian troops stalled outside Kyiv, British intelligence says
articles.description: Russian forces advancing on the Ukraine capital Kyiv from the northeast have stalled, British intelligence said on Monday, as Ukraine rejected Russian calls for defenders to lay down their arms in the besieged city of Mariupol.

thumbnail.caption: A child sits on the shoulders of a man near a building damaged during Ukraine-Russia conflict in the besieged southern port city of Mariupol, Ukraine March 20, 2022. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko
thumbnail.alt_text: Local residents walk in the besieged city of Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: Local residents walk in the besieged city of Mariupol

articles.title: As fighting rages in Mariupol, Ukraine's Zelenskiy appeals for help from Israel
articles.description: Russian and Ukrainian forces fought for the Ukrainian port city of Mariupol on Sunday, where residents are trapped with little food, water and power, while Ukraine's president appealed to Israel for help in pushing back Russia's assault.

thumbnail.caption: A child sits on the shoulders of a man near a building damaged during Ukraine-Russia conflict in the besieged southern port city of Mariupol, Ukraine March 20, 2022. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko
thumbnail.alt_text: Local residents walk in the besieged city of Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: Local residents walk in the besieged city of Mariupol

articles.title: Mariupol says thousands deported from besieged Ukrainian city
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Russia's siege of the port city of Mariupol was "a terror that will be remembered for centuries to come", while local authorities said thousands of residents there had been taken by force across the border.

thumbnail.caption: A general view of market Barabashovo after a fire caused by shelling, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Kharkiv, Ukraine March 19, 2022. REUTERS/Oleksandr Lapshyn
thumbnail.alt_text: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Kharkiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Kharkiv

articles.title: Mariupol searches for survivors amid rubble of theatre
articles.description: Rescue workers were searching for survivors in the rubble of a theatre in the besieged city of Mariupol on Thursday, after Ukraine said a powerful Russian air strike hit the building where hundreds of people had been sheltering from the war.

thumbnail.caption: General view of the remains of the drama theatre which was hit by a bomb when hundreds of people were sheltering inside, amid ongoing Russia's invasion, in Mariupol, Ukraine, in this handout picture released March 18, 2022. Azov Handout/ via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: General view of the remains of the drama theatre which was hit by a bomb in Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: General view of the remains of the drama theatre which was hit by a bomb in Mariupol

articles.title: Ukraine says it stands firm on recognition of 1991 borders
articles.description: Ukraine's president has not altered his stance that his country's borders must be recognised as the frontiers it had at the time of the Soviet Union's collapse in 1991, an aide said on Thursday.

thumbnail.caption: Ukraine?s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy delivers a video address to senators and members of the House of Representatives gathered in the Capitol Visitor Center Congressional Auditorium at the U.S. Capitol in Washington, U.S., March 16, 2022. REUTERS/Sarah Silbiger/Pool
thumbnail.alt_text: Ukraineâ€™s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy delivers video address to members of the U.S. Congress at the Capitol in Washington
thumbnail.subtitle: Ukraineâ€™s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy delivers video address to members of the U.S. Congress at the Capitol in Washington

articles.title: Peace talks more 'realistic', says Ukraine president; Biden to visit NATO
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Wednesday peace talks were sounding more realistic but more time was needed, as Russian air strikes killed five people in the capital Kyiv and the refugee tally from Moscow's invasion reached 3 million.

thumbnail.caption: A woman walks with a bicycle next to a building damaged during Ukraine-Russia conflict in the separatist-controlled town of Volnovakha in the Donetsk region, Ukraine March 15, 2022. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko
thumbnail.alt_text: A woman walks with a bicycle next to a damaged building in Volnovakha
thumbnail.subtitle: A woman walks with a bicycle next to a damaged building in Volnovakha

articles.title: Biden plans first Europe visit since Ukraine invasion as refugees surpass 3 million
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will make his first visit to Europe since the invasion of Ukraine to discuss the crisis with NATO allies next week, the White House said on Tuesday as the refugee tally hit 3 million amid more Russian air strikes.

thumbnail.caption: Rescuers work next to a residential building damaged by shelling, as Russia's attack on Ukraine continues, in Kyiv, Ukraine, in this handout picture released March 15, 2022.  Press service of the State Emergency Service of Ukraine/Handout via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: Rescuers work next to a residential building damaged by shelling in Kyiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Rescuers work next to a residential building damaged by shelling in Kyiv

articles.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of blocking aid convoy to besieged Mariupol
articles.description: Ukraine accused Russia on Tuesday of blocking a convoy trying to take supplies to the besieged city of Mariupol, where the Red Cross said desperate families were being "suffocated" as food and water ran out.

thumbnail.caption: An aerial view shows damaged residential buildings, amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Mariupol, Ukraine March 14, 2022 in this still image taken from a drone footage obtained from social media. Azov regiment press service/via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: Still image from drone footage shows destruction across Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: Still image from drone footage shows destruction across Mariupol

articles.title: U.S. warns China not to help Russia as anti-war protest disrupts state TV
articles.description: The United States warned China after "intense" talks on Monday against helping Moscow in its invasion of Ukraine, while an anti-war protester interrupted Russian state TV news in an extraordinary act of dissent.

thumbnail.caption: Firefighters look at a residential building that was hit by a shell as Russia's attack on Ukraine continues, in the Obolon district in Kyiv, Ukraine, March 14, 2022.  REUTERS/Thomas Peter
thumbnail.alt_text: Firefighters look at a residential building that was hit by a shell in the Obolon district in Kyiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Firefighters look at a residential building that was hit by a shell in the Obolon district in Kyiv

articles.title: Convoy of civilians leaves Ukraine's Mariupol after days of failed attempts
articles.description: A convoy of at least 160 cars left Mariupol on Monday in the first successful attempt to arrange a humanitarian corridor out of the encircled Ukrainian city after over a week of trying.

thumbnail.caption: An aeriel view shows smoke rising as an armoured vehicle is shot at next to a building, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Maripuol, Ukraine as uploaded on March 13, 2022, in this handout drone video obtained by Reuters on March 13, 2022. Azov Mariupol/Handout via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: An aeriel view shows smoke rising as an armoured vehicle is shot at next to a building, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Maripuol
thumbnail.subtitle: An aeriel view shows smoke rising as an armoured vehicle is shot at next to a building, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Maripuol

articles.title: Russian strike on base brings Ukraine war close to NATO's border
articles.description: A barrage of Russian missiles hit a large Ukrainian base near the border with NATO member Poland on Sunday, killing 35 people and wounding 134, a local official said, in an escalation of the war to the west of the country as fighting raged elsewhere.

thumbnail.caption: Smoke rises amid damaged buildings following an attack on the Yavoriv military base, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Yavoriv, Lviv Oblast, Ukraine, March 13, 2022 in this picture obtained from social media. @BackAndAlive/via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: Smoke rises amid damaged buildings following an attack on the Yavoriv military base, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Yavoriv
thumbnail.subtitle: Smoke rises amid damaged buildings following an attack on the Yavoriv military base, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in Yavoriv

articles.title: Ukraine says Russian forces kill seven civilians in evacuation convoy
articles.description: Ukraine accused Russian forces on Saturday of killing seven civilians in an attack on women and children trying to flee fighting near Kyiv, and France said Russian President Vladimir Putin had shown he was not ready to make peace.

thumbnail.caption: Smoke rises after shelling near Kyiv, Ukraine March 12, 2022. REUTERS/Gleb Garanich
thumbnail.alt_text: Smoke rises after shelling near Kyiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Smoke rises after shelling near Kyiv

articles.title: Ukraine at 'turning point', Zelenskiy says as Russians regroup near Kyiv
articles.description: Ukraine was at a turning point in the war with Russian forces appearing to be regroup for a possible assault on Kyiv, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said, as the United States imposed new sanctions on senior Kremlin officials and Russian oligarchs.

thumbnail.caption: Smoke rises after shelling near Kyiv, Ukraine March 11, 2022. REUTERS/Gleb Garanich
thumbnail.alt_text: Smoke rises after shelling near Kyiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Smoke rises after shelling near Kyiv

articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy defiant as Russian forces, despite setbacks, regroup near Kyiv
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday Ukraine was at a "strategic turning point" in the war as Russian forces bombarded cities across the country and appeared to be regrouping for a possible assault on Kyiv, with satellite images showing them firing artillery as they closed in on the capital.

thumbnail.caption: A Ukrainian soldier hides from a helicopter airstrike amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, near Demydiv, Ukraine March 10, 2022.  REUTERS/Maksim Levin
thumbnail.alt_text: Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, near Demydiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, near Demydiv

articles.title: Ukraine says situation in encircled city of Mariupol is 'critical'
articles.description: Ukraine said on Friday the situation in Mariupol was now critical as Russian forces tightened their noose around the Black Sea port city and the death toll from Russian shelling and a 12-day blockade reached almost 1,600.

thumbnail.caption: The aftermath of Russian artillery shelling on a residential area in Mariupol where a rocket hit a house, according to the Armed Forces of Ukraine, during the Russian invasion of Ukraine, in Mariupol, Ukraine, is seen in this screengrab from a video uploaded on social media on March 10, 2022. Armed Forces of Ukraine/Handout via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: The aftermath of artillery shelling by Russia is seen on a residential area, in Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: The aftermath of artillery shelling by Russia is seen on a residential area, in Mariupol

articles.title: Ukraine to sow as many crops as possible this spring - President
articles.description: Ukraine must sow as many crops as possible this spring, despite the Russian invasion, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday.

thumbnail.caption: Ears of wheat are seen in a field near the village of Hrebeni in Kyiv region, Ukraine July 17, 2020. Picture taken July 17, 2020.  REUTERS/Valentyn Ogirenko/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Ears of wheat are seen in a field in Kyiv region
thumbnail.subtitle: Ears of wheat are seen in a field in Kyiv region

articles.title: Russian forces regroup near Kyiv after setbacks
articles.description: Russian forces bearing down on Kyiv are regrouping northwest of the Ukrainian capital, satellite pictures showed, in what Britain said could be preparation for an assault on the city within days.

thumbnail.caption: A Ukrainian soldier hides from a helicopter airstrike amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, near Demydiv, Ukraine March 10, 2022.  REUTERS/Maksim Levin
thumbnail.alt_text: Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, near Demydiv
thumbnail.subtitle: Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, near Demydiv

articles.title: Besieged Ukrainians endure bombardments, with no breakthrough in talks
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of civilians remained trapped in Ukrainian cities on Thursday, sheltering from Russian air raids and shelling as talks between Ukraine and Russia's foreign ministers made little apparent progress.

thumbnail.caption: A view shows cars and a building of a hospital destroyed by an aviation strike amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Mariupol, Ukraine, in this handout picture released March 9, 2022.  Press service of the National Police of Ukraine/Handout via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: A view shows cars and a building of a hospital destroyed by aviation strike in Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: A view shows cars and a building of a hospital destroyed by aviation strike in Mariupol

articles.title: Ukraine says Russian troops at gas compressor stations pose supply risk
articles.description: The arrival of Russian troops at two gas compressor stations in eastern Ukraine poses a risk to European supplies, Ukraine's gas pipeline operator warned on Thursday, although there were no signs of an immediate impact on flows.

thumbnail.caption: 3D printed Natural Gas Pipes are placed on displayed Russia's and Ukraine's flags in this illustration taken, January 31, 2022. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows Natural Gas Pipes and Russia's and Ukraine's flags
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows Natural Gas Pipes and Russia's and Ukraine's flags

articles.title: Russian shelling hinders efforts to help trapped Mariupol residents
articles.description: Russian shelling of Mariupol on Thursday prevented a humanitarian convoy reaching the besieged Ukrainian city, local officials said, and dented hopes of evacuating trapped civilians who are increasingly desperate for supplies.

thumbnail.caption: Ships are seen near the Azov Sea port of Mariupol, Ukraine December 2, 2018.  REUTERS/Gleb Garanich/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Ships are seen near the Azov Sea port of Mariupol
thumbnail.subtitle: Ships are seen near the Azov Sea port of Mariupol
